metadata.name: HackTool - Jlaive In-Memory Assembly Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the use of Jlaive to execute assemblies in a copied PowerShell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('.bat')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\xcopy.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('powershell.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.bat.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\xcopy.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pwsh.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.bat.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\attrib.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('+s')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('+h')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.bat.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of Jlaive to execute assemblies in a copied PowerShell
